article:
'Systemic circulation' is the part of the cardiovascular system which carries
oxygenated blood away from the heart to the body, and returns deoxygenated blood
back to the heart. This physiologic theory of circulation was first described by
Amato Lusitano (JoÃ£o Rodrigues from Castelo Branco, 1511-1568), a Portuguese
doctor working in Italy, in his work composed by seven volumes [[Curationum
Medicinalium CenturiÃ¦ Septem]] 1st. edition in 1551. He was the first to
describe venous valves. [http://www.cryptojews.com/Amatus%20Lusitanus.htm
Amatus Lusitanus discovered valves in veins and arteries; by David Hashavit],
citation: "There's a reasonable basis to assume that it was Dr. Amatus who first
discovered the "Blood circulation" phenomena"  In 1628 William Harvey
launches his De motu cordis. Harvey, W., Exercitatio anatomica de motu
cordis et sanguinis in animalibus, Frankfurt, W. Fitzeri, 1628

This term is opposed and contrasted to the term pulmonary circulation first
